text: but the questions for the inquiry were
whether it was right and necessary to
invade Iraq in March 2003 and whether
the UK could and should have been best
prepared for what followed we have
concluded that the UK chose to join the
invasion of Iraq before the peaceful
options for disarmament had been
exhausted military action at that time
was not a last resort
we have also concluded that the
judgments about the severity of the
threat posed by Iraq's weapons of mass
destruction WMD were presented with a
certainty that was not justified despite
explicit warnings the consequences of
the invasion were underestimated the
planning and preparations for Iraq after
Saddam Hussein were wholly inadequate
the government failed to achieve its
stated objectives
